Introduction
AQUPEC MG is the most recent innovation of
Sumitomo Seika. AQUPEC MG not only has the
significant thickening capability of AQUPEC
thickener family which allows getting highly
viscous medium at low polymer concentration
but also, due to its unique structure, is able to
provide new fresher and lighter texture to a
wide range of formulations. Moreover, its

singular properties in solution make AQUPEC MG
the best candidate for spray applications. In these
applications, AQUPEC MG is able to achieve high
viscosity without sacrificing essential spray
properties such as sprayability.
Benefits
OHigh thickening capability
OFresh and light texture
Enhances sprayability
OFlexible addition
OPre-neutralized carbomer
OEasy to disperse
OBetter flowability
OLess creasing
Additionally, as it is a pre-neutralized polymer,
no addition of base is required, avoiding possible
instability of pH sensitive raw materials and
decreasing the overall cost due to the elimination
of a process step. Furthermore, AQUPEC MG can
be added in any preparation step, even at the end
of formulation process, allowing modification and
correction of formula viscosity.
1

## Page 2

SUMITOMO SEIKA
TECHNICAL DATA SHEET
Thickening mechanism
AQUPEC MG high thickening capacity lies in
the polymeric
structure
of
cross-linked
polyacrylate. When AQUPEC MG is dissolved in
water, due
to the repulsion between
carboxylates, polymer chains expand generating
a three dimensional network, resulting in a
highly viscous gel (Figure 1). In contrast to other
carbomers, in the case of AQUPEC MG,
neutralization step is not required, giving a pH
close to neutral without any further pH
modification.
Basic polymer properties in water
- Easy to disperse and handle
- High thickening capability
- Applicable for wide range of pH
- Fresh and light texture
- Less creasing
-
Sprayable solution/emulsion
Easy to disperse and handle
One of the most important issues formulators
face in the use of commonly-used carbomers is
the management of addition method and
dispersion time. Such carbomers are composed
of irregularly shaped small particles of under
10um, and the flowability of the polymers is
poor. Thus, handling is not easy. On the other
hand, the handleability has been significantly
improved in AQUPEC MG. Due to its 10-30um
spherical and uniform shape, AQUPEC MG is easy
to handle and has great flowability. Moreover,
the dissolution process has been notably
improved as well. In the case of commonly-used
carbomers, slow addition, special equipment, and
highly skilled operators are needed in order to
avoid lump formation, which leads to longer
dispersion time. However, AQUPEC MG has great
dispersibility in water, and rarely forms lumps. As
figure 2 shows, even the addition of AQUPEC MG
without any stirring yields a fresh and free of
lump gel.

High thickening capability
AQUPEC MG is an extremely efficient rheology
modifier with high thickening capability. The
addition of small amount of AQUPEC MG into
water enhances texture properties, resulting in
a fresh and consistent gel. As figure 3 shows,
even at low polymer concentration, medium
viscosity is significantly high. The increase in
polymer concentration leads to further increase
in viscosity. Additionally, AQUPEC MG can be
used in a large pH range (Figure 4) and the
viscosity of AQUPEC MG gels is not significantly
affected by temperature (Figure 5). Therefore, by
tuning pH and polymer concentration, AQUPEC
MG allows the preparation of a wide range of
formulations by using it as single thickener.
The high shear thinning rheology profile of
AQUPEC MG (Figure 6) is highly appreciated in
formulations because it provides not only high
viscosity and initial texture but also easy and
comfortable rub-in characteristics.

## Page 4

SUMITOMO SEIKA
TECHNICAL DATA SHEET
Texture
The unique structure of AQUPEC MG allows
the preparation of formulations with new
textures, especially with fresher and lighter
feelings than those of normal carbomers.
Textures are related to product rheology in
general, or more specifically, to rheology data in
yield point. Strain and stress in the yield point
can be correlated, respectively, with the
freshness and lightness (Figure 7). Products
with lower yield strain and yield stress
respectively have fresher feeling and lighter
feeling. As shown in Figure 7, compared with
Carbomer (AQUPEC HV-505E), AQUPEC MG
aqueous gel's yield strain and yield stress are
lower, leading to fresher and lighter feeling.
Similar tendency is observed in the final
products such as gel cream, cleansing gel and
moisture cream. Both yield strain and yield
stress of products with AQUPEC MG are
significantly lower than those of Carbomer,
proving that new texture observed in AQUPEC
MG aqueous gel can be easily transferred to the
final products (Figure 8).

Creasing effect
Creasing effect, the polymer deposition when
rubbed in, tends to occur in cosmetic products
(especially in skin-care products) which contain
polymers such as Carbomer. Creasing has a
negative effect in the customer perception as it
can be considered unpleasant, therefore,
decreasing the product acceptance. Several
studies have confirmed that, when compared
with cosmetic products containing Carbomer,
those containing AQUPEC MG produced hardly
any creasing even at high concentration of
AQUPEC MG (Figure 9 and Table 1).

Spray applications
Spray products (non-aerosol) have several
beneficial features such as better and faster
to rub in when compared with other types of
products. With the use of traditional
thickeners, a compromise between good
standing
up/feeling
properties
and
sprayability should be made when spray is
formulated. On the other hand, high viscosity
of AQUPEC MG provides better stability,
texture and stronger hold and prevents
dripping after spraying. Generally speaking,
viscosity decreases product pumpability
through nozzle and spray atomization area. As
figure 11 shows, when Carbomer is used, an
increase in viscosity significantly lowers spray
100mm
Spray area
Figure 10: Measuring method of spray area
area and therefore applicability.
The use of AQUPEC MG solves this issue,
facilitating the preparation of highly thick spray
products, and opening
a
door for
improvements in current formulation and the
preparation of new ones which have been
difficult to achieve until now. As shown in
figure 11, comparing with the normal behavior
explained previously, highly viscous stiff gel
containing AQUPEC MG is easy to spray, and
has similar spray area, while keeping all the
excellent properties AQUPEC MG gives to
products such as high stability and fresh texture
as well as non-drip property.

Storage & Handling
AQUPEC MG is very hygroscopic and swells
quickly in the presence of water. Keep the
container closed when not in use, and store in a
dry and dark area.
Packing
20kg paper
with
Alumium/PE
internal
protective layer.

Procedure:
1. Prepare Phase A. Mix materials 1 to 5 and stir
until dissolved at 80ºC.
2. In a separate beaker, prepare Phase B. Mix
materials 6 to 11 and stir until dissolved at
80ºC.
3. Slowly add Phase C to Phase B. Keep stirring
until polymer is fully dissolved.
4. Prepare Phase D by mixing materials 13 to 15.
5. Slowly add Phase A to Phase B. Stir well until
emulsion is uniformly made (Homomixer is
recommended).
6. Cool down the formulation to 40℃ while
stirring and stir in Phase D.
7. Allow it to cool until room temperature and
store it.

gpt_manufacturer_or_supplier_reason: The technical data sheet for AQUPEC MG N40R prominently features Sumitomo Seika as the manufacturer. The document header and footer on multiple pages identify Sumitomo Seika Chemicals Co., Ltd. as the source, and the contact information for Sumitomo Seika Chemicals Co., Ltd. is provided on the last page, confirming them as the manufacturer or supplier of AQUPEC MG N40R.
gpt_select_industry_cluster_reason: Selected Personal Care because the document mentions formulations such as gel cream, cleansing gel, and moisture cream, which are typical personal care products. The product's benefits like fresh and light texture, sprayability, and use in cosmetic formulations confirm its relevance to Personal Care. There is no mention of applications related to Homecare or Institutional Cleaning in the document.
gpt_select_compositions_reason: Selected Synthetic because the product is described as a partially neutralized carboxyvinyl polymer sodium salt (Sodium Carbomer), a synthetic polymer. There is no mention of biomolecules, derived natural, mineral, or vegetal sources in the document.
gpt_select_functions_reason: Selected Rheology Modifier because the document repeatedly mentions AQUPEC MG's high thickening capability, viscosity control, shear thinning behavior, and stable viscosity over pH and temperature ranges (Sections 3, 4, 6). Selected Skin Sensory Additive because the product provides a fresher and lighter texture with less creasing and better rub-in characteristics (Sections 3, 7, 8, 9). Selected Others because the product is a thickener polymer with unique sprayability and handling properties not covered by other categories (Sections 1, 3, 9). No evidence in the document supports other functions such as emulsifier, preservative, antioxidant, or active ingredient roles.
gpt_select_applications_reason: Selected Skin Care because the document describes AQUPEC MG as a thickener used in cosmetic formulations such as gel cream and milky lotion with fresh and light textures, which are typical skin care products. No mention or indication of use in other application categories is provided.
gpt_cas_from_doc_reason: The CAS Registry Number 9003-04-7 is explicitly listed under section 2 'Chemical and Physical Characteristics' for AQUPEC MG N40R from Sumitomo Seika Chemicals Co., Ltd.
gpt_physical_form_reason: Selected Powder because the document explicitly mentions the appearance of AQUPEC MG N40R as 'White powder' in section 2 Chemical and Physical Characteristics.
gpt_gen_product_description: AQUPEC MG N40R is a pre-neutralized sodium carbomer offered by Sumitomo Seika Chemicals Co., Ltd. It appears as a white spherical powder with particle sizes between 10-30 µm, providing excellent flowability and easy dispersion. This polymer delivers high thickening power at low concentrations, creating fresh, light textures ideal for sprayable gels and lotions. Its stable viscosity across a wide pH and temperature range, combined with minimal creasing and enhanced sprayability, makes it suitable for cosmetic formulations requiring smooth, non-sticky, and easily applied products.
gpt_recommended_dosage_answer: Sodium Carbomer (AQUPEC MG) 0.90% in Gel Cream formulation; Sodium Carbomer (AQUPEC MG) 0.20% in Milky Lotion formulation
gpt_recommended_dosage_reason: Dosage is specified in section 12 'Guide Formulation Examples' where AQUPEC MG is used at 0.90% in Gel Cream and 0.20% in Milky Lotion formulations.
gpt_certifications_reason: No certifications related to AQUPEC MG N40R or Sumitomo Seika Chemicals Co., Ltd. are mentioned in the provided technical data sheet.
gpt_claims_reason: No claims related to any anti-aging, antimicrobial, antioxidant, moisturizing, skin repair, or other functional cosmetic benefits are mentioned in the document. The data sheet focuses exclusively on the thickening capability, texture improvement, sprayability, rheological properties, and ease of handling of AQUPEC MG N40R as a polymer thickener. There is no mention of biological or skin/hair care benefits that would support any of the listed claims.
gpt_health_benefits_reason: Only applicable for FBI business line
